class.name: MessagePackRPC
class.brief_description: A class to process the MessagePack-RPC connection.
class.description: The [MessagePackRPC] enables the RPC over a TCP connection which using the MessagePack protocol. [b]Note:[/b] If you don't want to communicate with a server or client, and just want to convert a MessagePack byte array to a Godot's value, or convert Godot's value to a MessagePack byte array, consider the [MessagePack] class.

signal.name: rpc_connected
signal.description: Emitted when the rpc connection established.

signal.name: rpc_disconnected
signal.description: Emitted when the rpc connection closed.

signal.name: got_error
signal.description: Emitted when the there is an error.

signal.name: message_received
signal.description: Emitted when the message is received.

signal.name: request_received
signal.description: Emitted when the request message is received. [b]Note:[/b] If the request call a method registered, it will not emit signal.

signal.name: response_received
signal.description: Emitted when the response message is received. [b]Note:[/b] If called synchronously, the response will not emit signal.

signal.name: notification_received
signal.description: Emitted when the notification message is received. [b]Note:[/b] If the notification call a method registered, it will not emit signal.

method.name: make_message_byte_array
method.description: Make a MessagePack byte array from a message array. Only supports message defined in the spec above. Any other type of message will not be encoded and return an empty array. [codeblock] var msg_buf = MessagePackRPC.make_message_byte_array([MessagePackRPC.REQUEST, msgid, "test", [1, 2.3, false, {"test" : true}]]) [/codeblock]

method.name: make_request
method.description: Make a MessagePack request byte array.

method.name: make_response
method.description: Make a MessagePack response byte array.

method.name: make_notification
method.description: Make a MessagePack notification byte array.

method.name: connect_to_host
takeover_connection
register_extension_type
method.description: Register decoder for the extension type data process. The decoder expect [code]type_id[/code]([int]) and [code]data[/code]([PackedByteArray]) for parameters, then return a [Variant] for the result. [b]Note:[/b] Decoder registered only works for stream parse.

method.name: register_request
method.description: Register a request, when a rpc call the [code]method[/code] by a request, the [code]callable[/code] will be called. The [code]callable[/code] expect [code]msgid[/code]([int]), [code]method[/code]([String]) and [code]params[/code]([Array]) for parameters. See the example under [method takeover_connection] Returns an [enum Error] when register failed. See the example under [method takeover_connection]. [b]Note:[/b] When registered, the request which call [code]method[/code] will not emit signal.

method.name: register_notification
method.description: Register a notification, when a rpc call the [code]method[/code] by a notification, the [code]callable[/code] will be called. The [code]callable[/code] expect [code]method[/code]([String]) and [code]params[/code]([Array]) for parameters. See the example under [method takeover_connection] Returns an [enum Error] when register failed. [b]Note:[/b] When registered, the notification which call [code]method[/code] will not emit signal.

method.name: get_next_msgid
method.description: Get the next message id. [b]Note:[/b] Not recommend to use this method, unless you want implement rpc communication manually. The [MessagePackRPC] object will manage msgid automatically.

method.name: set_next_msgid
method.description: Set the next message id. [b]Note:[/b] Not recommend to use this method, unless you want implement rpc communication manually. The [MessagePackRPC] object will manage msgid automatically.

method.name: sync_callv
method.description: Call remote method synchronously. Returns an empty array when timeout. [b]Note:[/b] Synchronous call will not emit signal when the response received.

method.name: async_callv
method.description: Call remote method asynchronously. [b]Note:[/b] Asynchronous call will not return the result directly, use the signal [signal response_received] to get the response message.
